docblock.description: Klein (klein.php) - A lightning fast router for PHP

docblock.long-description:
Allows the ability to arbitrarily request a service from this instance while treating it as an instance property

This checks the lazy service register and automatically calls the registered service method
Allows the ability to arbitrarily call a property as a callable method Allow callbacks to be assigned as properties and called like normal methods

tag.description: The argument array to pass to our callback

tag.description: The callable function to execute when requesting our service

docblock.long-description:
A generic collection class to contain array-like data, specifically designed to work with HTTP data (request params, session data, etc)

Inspired by @fabpot's Symfony 2's HttpFoundation

docblock.description: Klein (klein.php) - A lightning fast router for PHP

docblock.long-description: A DataCollection for HTTP response cookies

{@inheritdoc}

A value may either be a string or a ResponseCookie instance String values will be converted into a ResponseCookie with the "name" of the cookie being set from the "key"

Obviously, the developer is free to organize this collection however they like, and can be more explicit by passing a more suggested "$key" as the cookie's "domain" and passing in an instance of a ResponseCookie as the "$value"

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the cookie to set

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value of the cookie to set

docblock.long-description:
A DataCollection for "$_SERVER" like data

Look familiar?

Inspired by @fabpot's Symfony 2's HttpFoundation

docblock.description: The prefix of HTTP headers normally stored in the Server data
The list of HTTP headers that for some reason aren't prefixed in PHP.
Quickly check if a string has a passed prefix
Get our headers from our server data collection
docblock.long-description: PHP is weird... it puts all of the HTTP request headers in the $_SERVER array. This handles that

docblock.long-description: Exception used for when a service is attempted to be registered that already exists

docblock.description: Klein (klein.php) - A lightning fast router for PHP

docblock.long-description:
Exception interface that Klein's exceptions should implement

This is mostly for having a simple, common Interface class/namespace that can be type-hinted/instance-checked against, therefore making it easier to handle Klein exceptions while still allowing the different exception classes to properly extend the corresponding SPL Exception type

docblock.long-description: HTTP status code and message translator

property.name: $http_messages
property.default: array(100 => 'Continue', 101 => 'Switching Protocols', 200 => 'OK', 201 => 'Created', 202 => 'Accepted', 203 => 'Non-Authoritative Information', 204 => 'No Content', 205 => 'Reset Content', 206 => 'Partial Content', 300 => 'Multiple Choices', 301 => 'Moved Permanently', 302 => 'Found', 303 => 'See Other', 304 => 'Not Modified', 305 => 'Use Proxy', 306 => '(Unused)', 307 => 'Temporary Redirect', 400 => 'Bad Request', 401 => 'Unauthorized', 402 => 'Payment Required', 403 => 'Forbidden', 404 => 'Not Found', 405 => 'Method Not Allowed', 406 => 'Not Acceptable', 407 => 'Proxy Authentication Required', 408 => 'Request Timeout', 409 => 'Conflict', 410 => 'Gone', 411 => 'Length Required', 412 => 'Precondition Failed', 413 => 'Request Entity Too Large', 414 => 'Request-URI Too Long', 415 => 'Unsupported Media Type', 416 => 'Requested Range Not Satisfiable', 417 => 'Expectation Failed', 500 => 'Internal Server Error', 501 => 'Not Implemented', 502 => 'Bad Gateway', 503 => 'Service Unavailable', 504 => 'Gateway Timeout', 505 => 'HTTP Version Not Supported')

docblock.description: HTTP 1.1 status messages based on code

tag.name: param
tag.description: (optional) HTTP message for the corresponding code

docblock.description: Get a string representation of our HTTP status

docblock.long-description: Allows the ability to arbitrarily use an instance of this class as a string This method will be automatically called, returning a string representation of this instance

docblock.description: Get our HTTP 1.1 message from our passed code
docblock.long-description: Returns null if no corresponding message was found for the passed in code

docblock.description: Klein (klein.php) - A lightning fast router for PHP

docblock.long-description: Main Klein router class
Don't capture anything. Behave as normal.
Capture all output and return it from dispatch
Capture all output and replace the response body with it
Capture all output and prepend it to the response body
Capture all output and append it to the response body

docblock.description: Array of the routes to match on dispatch
The namespace of which to collect the routes in when matching, so you can define routes under a common endpoint
An array of error callback callables
The Request object passed to each matched route
The Response object passed to each matched route
The service provider object passed to each matched route
A generic variable passed to each matched route

docblock.long-description: Create a new Klein instance with optionally injected dependencies This DI allows for easy testing, object mocking, or class extension

tag.name: param
tag.description: Service provider object responsible for utilitarian behaviors

tag.name: param
tag.description: An object passed to each route callback, defaults to a new App instance

docblock.description: Add a new route to be matched on dispatch
docblock.long-description:
This method takes its arguments in a very loose format The only "required" parameter is the callback (which is very strange considering the argument definition order)

$router = new Klein();

$router->respond( function() {
    echo 'this works';
});
$router->respond( '/endpoint', function() {
    echo 'this also works';
});
$router->respond( 'POST', '/endpoint', function() {
    echo 'this also works!!!!';
});

tag.name: param
tag.description: Callable callback method to execute on route match

docblock.description: Collect a set of routes under a common namespace
docblock.long-description:
The routes may be passed in as either a callable (which holds the route definitions), or as a string of a filename, of which to "include" under the Klein router scope

$router = new Klein();

$router->with('/users', function() use ( $router) {
    $router->respond( '/', function() {
        // do something interesting
    });
    $router->respond( '/[i:id]', function() {
        // do something different
    });
});

$router->with('/cars', __DIR__ . '/routes/cars.php');

tag.name: param
tag.description: The namespace under which to collect the routes

tag.name: param
tag.description: | string[filename] $routes The defined routes to collect under the namespace

docblock.description: Dispatch the request to the approriate route(s)
docblock.long-description: Dispatch with optionally injected dependencies This DI allows for easy testing, object mocking, or class extension

tag.description: The request object to give to each callback

tag.name: param

$request->method('post') // returns true
$request->method('get') // returns false

docblock.description: Get (or set) the HTTP protocol version
docblock.long-description: Simply calling this method without any arguments returns the current protocol version. Calling with an integer argument, however, attempts to set the protocol version to what was provided by the argument.

docblock.description: Get (or set) the response's body content
docblock.long-description: Simply calling this method without any arguments returns the current response body. Calling with an argument, however, sets the response body to what was provided by the argument.

docblock.description: Get (or set) the HTTP response code
docblock.long-description: Simply calling this method without any arguments returns the current response code. Calling with an integer argument, however, attempts to set the response code to what was provided by the argument.
